Authenticate this session

A wrapper for gar_auth and gar_auth_service

gce_auth(new_user = FALSE, no_auto = FALSE)

Arguments

new_user
If TRUE, reauthenticate via Google login screen
no_auto
Will ignore auto-authentication settings if TRUE If you have set the environment variable GCE_AUTH_FILE to a valid file location, the function will look there for authentication details. Otherwise it will look in the working directory for the `.httr-oauth` file, which if not present will trigger an authentication flow via Google login screen in your browser. If GCE_AUTH_FILE is specified, then gce_auth() will be called upon loading the package via library(googleComputeEngineR), meaning that calling this function yourself at the start of the session won't be necessary. GCE_AUTH_FILE can be either a token generated by gar_auth or service account JSON ending with file extension .json

Value

Invisibly, the token that has been saved to the session
